DataElement.preferredDefinition: Anatomic location in which radiation therapy was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the radiation therapy field.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (RAY-dee-AY-shun) The use of high-energy radiation from x-rays, gamma rays, neutrons, and other sources to kill cancer cells and shrink tumors. Radiation may come from a machine outside the body (external-beam radiation therapy) or from materials called radioisotopes. Radioisotopes produce radiation and can be placed in or near the tumor or in the area near cancer cells. This type of radiation treatment is called internal radiation therapy, implant radiation, interstitial radiation, or brachytherapy. Systemic radiation therapy uses a radioactive substance, such as a radiolabeled monoclonal antibody, that circulates throughout the body.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
An area of database record, or graphical user interface form, into which a particular item of data is entered.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the right side of the body.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the right side of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.: Any of the ring-shaped bony structures that constitute the spinal column and surround the spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

Any of thirty-three ring-shaped structures that form the vertebral column which surrounds and protects the spinal cord. Each vertebra consists of a bony body with its superior and inferior articular surfaces covered by hyaline cartilage. The body includes the centrum anteriorly and vertebral arch posteriorly. The articular surfaces of the vertebrae are connected by a fibrocartilaginous intervertebral disc.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The long, flat bone connecting with the cartilages of the first seven ribs and the clavicle.

Concepts.definition: The long, flat bone connecting with the cartilages of the first seven ribs and the clavicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue that constitutes the essential part of an organ as contrasted with e.g., connective tissue and blood vessels.: The elongated, approximately cylindrical part of the central nervous system of vertebrates that lies in the vertebral canal and from which the spinal nerves emerge.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that constitutes the essential part of an organ as contrasted with e.g., connective tissue and blood vessels.
The elongated, approximately cylindrical part of the central nervous system of vertebrates that lies in the vertebral canal and from which the spinal nerves emerge.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bones that form the head, made up of the bones of the braincase and face.

Concepts.definition: The bones that form the head, made up of the bones of the braincase and face.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum' by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lower part of the abdomen that contains the intestines (the last part of the digestive tract), the stomach, and the liver. It is bound by thin membranes.

Concepts.definition: The potential space located between the parietal and visceral layers of the peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

Concepts.definition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The caudal portion of the trunk, bounded anteriorly and laterally by the two hip bones incorporating the socket portion of the hip joint for each leg. Posteriorly it is bounded by the sacrum and coccyx.

Concepts.definition: The caudal portion of the trunk, bounded anteriorly and laterally by the two hip bones incorporating the socket portion of the hip joint for each leg. Posteriorly it is bounded by the sacrum and coccyx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to muscles and/or tissue adjacent to the spinal column.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to muscles and/or tissue adjacent to the spinal column.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa.  Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa. Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa.  Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa. Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.

Concepts.definition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of organs surrounded by loose connective tissue, separating the two pleural sacs, between the sternum anteriorly and the vertebral column posteriorly as well as from the thoracic inlet superiorly to the diaphragm inferiorly. The mediastinum contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.

Concepts.definition: An anatomic site along the midline and under the sternum that contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Concepts.definition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PLOOR-a) A thin layer of tissue covering the lungs and the wall of the chest cavity to protect and cushion the lungs. A small amount of fluid that acts as a lubricant allows the lungs to move smoothly in the chest cavity during breathing.: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue that constitutes the essential part of an organ as contrasted with e.g., connective tissue and blood vessels.: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that constitutes the essential part of an organ as contrasted with e.g., connective tissue and blood vessels.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time.: A malignant neoplasm that has spread from its original site to the two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: The act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time.
A malignant neoplasm that has spread from its original site to the two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord.

PermissibleValues.value: Extradural extension into spinal canal from thorax and/or abdomen
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Epidural Hemorrhage Extend Into Vertebral Canal From Thorax And/Or Abdomen

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Epidural Hemorrhage Extend Into Vertebral Canal From Thorax And/Or Abdomen
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intracranial hemorrhage into the epidural space._To increase in length or duration._Expressing entrance, or a passing from the outside of a thing to its interior parts._The space formed by the series of vertebral foramina that courses the length of the vertebral column, and which houses the spinal cord and meninges._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._The division of the body lying between the neck and the abdomen._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

Concepts.definition: Intracranial hemorrhage into the epidural space.
To increase in length or duration.
Expressing entrance, or a passing from the outside of a thing to its interior parts.
The space formed by the series of vertebral foramina that courses the length of the vertebral column, and which houses the spinal cord and meninges.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
The division of the body lying between the neck and the abdomen.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

PermissibleValues.value: Diffuse bone disease on MIBG scan
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Diffuse Bone Iobenguane Scan Disease or Disorder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Diffuse Bone Iobenguane Scan Disease or Disorder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: widely spread; not localized or confined.: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.: A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.: The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Widely spread; not localized or confined.
The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.
The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue that constitutes the essential part of an organ as contrasted with e.g., connective tissue and blood vessels.: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that constitutes the essential part of an organ as contrasted with e.g., connective tissue and blood vessels.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated concept definition with current NCIt. 4.5.18 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, the abdomen.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, the abdomen.

The region on either side of the body that extends from the last rib to the hip.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation.

A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the spine or spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior and superior part of a human bearing the mouth, the brain and sensory organs.

Concepts.definition: The anterior and superior part of a human bearing the mouth, the brain and sensory organs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.
